channel.title: Use with OS SDK using CLI on OSSTD doc
channel.description: Recent content in Use with OS SDK using CLI on OSSTD doc

item.title: Get OpenStudio SDK
item.description: A. Install the correct version of OpenStudio SDK Download the latest release of OpenStudio SDK from OpenStudio Releases GitHub page. Select the installer that matches your operating system. The OpenStudio SDK installation package contains OpenStudio-Standards, EnergyPlus as well as other components (e.g., Ruby 2.7, etc..). For more installation information, refer to the OpenStudio Github page. Information about OpenStudio SDK CLI, refer to the Command Line Interface (CLI). The following table shows a compatibility matrix for OpenStudio SDK and “Create ASHRAE 90.

item.title: Run the measure
item.description: B. Run the measure with OS SDK using CLI There are 5 parts in the process of running the measure. Download the PRM measure (prerequisite) Setup a local directory Edit OSW file Execute the measure Save the Output 1. Download the PRM measure Download measure in the link below: Create Baseline Building: PerformanceRatingMethod.zip (977 KB) Refer to Install the measure for other installation options. 2. Setup a local directory Setup a local directory to include all required inputs (the following example is one way to setup the directory):

item.title: Run measure w/ OSSTD Package
item.description: C. Steps to run the measure with OSSTD Package (Optional) This instruction is provided for users who want to access the latest features or bug fixes that are not accessible in the latest OpenStudio SDK. Follow the steps from Run the measure instruction by replacing the Setup (Step 2) and Execution steps (Step 4) as mentioned below. Setup Download this openstudio-standards package. Unzip the package to a local directory.
